SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.DISTRIBUTOR: American Sign Language Linguistic Research Project, Boston University, Boston, MA.
SIGNSTREAM-DATABASE.AUTHOR: Fish, Sarah, Fran Conlin, Mike Schlang, Robert G. Lee, and Carol Neidle. The data have been transcribed at Boston University under the supervision of C. Neidle. We gratefully acknowledge assistance from Lana Cook and Carla DaSilva.

PARTICIPANT.LABEL: Mike
PARTICIPANT.NAME: Michael Schlang
PARTICIPANT.BACKGROUND: Education: Attended BSD (Boston School for the Deaf) and graduated from NNHS (Newton North); went Gallaudet University; graduated from CSUN (2003).

TRACK.A: About John giving mother chocolate, will he do it soon?
Did mother give chocolate to John?
John, he is giving chocolate to his mother now.
WOW. As for John's car, it was stolen.
I don't know if the teacher likes the movie, I (just) don't know.
He, John's father there, must buy this/that for Mary there.

UTTERANCE.NOTES: It's unclear how best to translate the final gesture, which asserts a certain attitude on the part of the signer. Not sure if the last IX is a loc or a pronoun.

TRACK.A: He, father, must buy a car for John (I'm telling you).
The teacher doesn't like the movie.
For how long has that student been reading the book?
The student there loves chocolate but doesn't like reading.
Mother doesn't want to buy a house.

UTTERANCE.NOTES: Interesting to see head shake simultaneously with head nod.

TRACK.A: The teacher enjoyed (the movie) but the kids did not like the movie.
How many books did the student read?
The student doesn't like to read but loves chocolate.
The teacher has been car shopping for a while now.
John's father there is giving a car to John.
Mother isn't buying a car for John.
Is that car there John's father's?
Has the teacher been car shopping lately(all this time)?
How many cars did the student buy (pay for)?
No, will she buy a house? No, John's mother doesn't want to buy a house.
The teacher enjoys reading but not movies.
Did John buy many books? How many did he buy?
He, John, gave his mother chocolate.
How many books has John read so far?

UTTERANCE.NOTES: Wonder if there is a small articulation of POSS-3p between JOHN and MOTHER?

TRACK.A: Is John's mother buying a house?

UTTERANCE.NOTES: I am not sure if GIFT is really two handed. the DOM hand seems to be mirroring the handshape of the ND hand, but the ND (left) hand articulates the sign fully.

TRACK.A: Will John give his father THAT CAR?
